charge_exchange.aperture.documentation: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic, relevant to all lines-of-sight (channels)

charge_exchange.aperture.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

charge_exchange.aperture.centre.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

charge_exchange.aperture.centre.phi_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "phi"

charge_exchange.aperture.centre.r_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

charge_exchange.aperture.centre.z_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

charge_exchange.aperture.geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

charge_exchange.aperture.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.

charge_exchange.aperture.outline.x1_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"

charge_exchange.aperture.outline.x2_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2"

charge_exchange.aperture.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

charge_exchange.aperture.radius_error_in.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

charge_exchange.aperture.surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

charge_exchange.aperture.surface_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

charge_exchange.aperture.x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

charge_exchange.aperture.x1_unit_vector..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

charge_exchange.aperture.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

charge_exchange.aperture.x1_width_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

charge_exchange.aperture.x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

charge_exchange.aperture.x2_unit_vector..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

charge_exchange.aperture.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

charge_exchange.aperture.x2_width_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

charge_exchange.aperture.x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

charge_exchange.aperture.x3_unit_vector..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

charge_exchange.channel.documentation: Set of channels (lines-of-sight). The line-of-sight is defined by the centre of the collimating aperture and the position of the measurements.

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.a.documentation: Mass of atom of the diagnostic neutral beam particle

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.a_error_i.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "a"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.doppler_s.documentation: Doppler shift due to the diagnostic neutral beam particle velocity
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.label.documentation: String identifying the diagnostic neutral beam particle

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.lorentz_s.documentation: Lorentz shift due to the Lorentz electric field (vxB) in the frame of the diagnostic neutral beam particles moving with a velocity v across the magnetic field B
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.radiances.documentation: Calibrated intensities of the 9 splitted lines (Stark effect due to Lorentz electric field). Note: radiances are integrated over the sightline crossing the neutral beam
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.transitio.documentation: Unshifted wavelength of the BES transition
Index in the error_description list for "transition_wavelength"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.z_ion.documentation: Ion charge of the diagnostic neutral beam particle

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.z_ion_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_ion"

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.z_n.documentation: Nuclear charge of the diagnostic neutral beam particle

charge_exchange.channel[:].bes.z_n_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion.documentation: Physical quantities related to ion species and charge stage (H+, D+, T+, He+2, Li+3, Be+4, C+6, N+7, O+8, Ne+10, Si+14, Ar+16 or Ar+18) derived from the measured charge exchange emission of each species, at the position of the measurement

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].a.documentation: Mass of atom of the ion

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].a_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "a"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].label.documentation: String identifying the ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+6, ...)

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].n_i_ov.documentation: Ion concentration (ratio of the ion density over the electron density) at the channel measurement point
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Description of the method used to derive the ion concentration
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].t_i.documentation: Ion temperature at the channel measurement point

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].t_i.da.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].t_i_me.documentation: Description of the method used to derive the ion temperature
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].veloci.documentation: Poloidal velocity of the ion (oriented clockwise when seen from front on the right side of the tokamak axi-symmetry axis) at the channel measurement point
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Description of the method used to reconstruct the ion poloidal velocity
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Toroidal velocity of the ion (oriented counter-clockwise when seen from above) at the channel measurement point
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Description of the method used to reconstruct the ion toroidal velocity
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].z_ion_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_ion"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion[:].z_n_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast.documentation: Derived Fast Ion Charge eXchange (FICX) parameters

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast[:].a.documentation: Mass of atom of the fast ion
Index in the error_description list for "a"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast[:].l.documentation: String identifying the fast ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+6, ...)

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast[:].r.documentation: Calibrated radiance of the fast ion charge exchange spectrum assuming the shape is pre-defined (e.g. by the Fokker-Planck slowing-down function). Note: radiance is integrated over the sightline crossing the neutral beam
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Description of the method used to reconstruct the fast ion charge exchange spectrum (e.g. what pre-defined slowing-down and source functions used)
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast[:].t.documentation: Unshifted wavelength of the fast ion charge exchange transition
Index in the error_description list for "transition_wavelength"

charge_exchange.channel[:].ion_fast[:].z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z_ion"
Nuclear charge of the fast ion
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

charge_exchange.channel[:].momentum_tor.documentation: Total plasma toroidal momentum, summed over ion species and electrons weighted by their density and major radius, i.e. sum_over_species(n*R*m*Vphi), at the channel measurement point

charge_exchange.channel[:].momentum_tor..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].momentum_tor_.documentation: Description of the method used to reconstruct the total plasma toroidal momentum
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].position.phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

charge_exchange.channel[:].position.phi..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].position.r.da.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].position.z.da.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum.documentation: Set of spectra obtained by various gratings

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "exposure_time"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].g.documentation: Number of grating lines per unit length
Index in the error_description list for "grating"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].i.documentation: Array of Gaussian widths and amplitudes which as a sum make up the instrument fuction. IF(lambda) = sum( instrument_function(1,i)/sqrt(2 * pi * instrument_function(2,i)^2  ) * exp( -lambda^2/(2 * instrument_function(2,i)^2) )  ),whereby sum( instrument_function(1,i) ) = 1
Index in the error_description list for "instrument_function"

Intensity spectrum (not calibrated), i.e. number of photoelectrons detected by unit time by a wavelength pixel of the channel, taking into account electronic gain compensation and channels relative calibration
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].p.documentation: Non-calibrated intensity (integrated over the spectrum for this line), i.e. number of photoelectrons detected by unit time, taking into account electronic gain compensation and channels relative calibration
Index in the error_description list for "data"

String identifying the processed spectral line: Spectroscopy notation emitting element (e.g. D I, Be IV,  W I, C VI), transition - if known - between round brackets (e.g. (3-2) ) and indication type of charge exchange - if applicable - between square brackets (e.g. [ACX] or [PCX]). Example for beryllium active charge exchange line at 468.5 nm: 'Be IV (8-6) [ACX]'. Example for impact excitation tungsten line coming from the plasma edge: 'W I'
Calibrated, background subtracted radiance (integrated over the spectrum for this line)
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Shift of the emission line wavelength with respected to the unshifted cental wavelength (e.g. Doppler shift)
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Unshifted central wavelength of the processed spectral line
Index in the error_description list for "wavelength_central"
Full width at Half Maximum (FWHM) of the emission line
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].r.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radiance_calibration"
Calibrated continuum intensity  in the middle of the spectrum per unit wavelength
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Calibrated spectral radiance (radiance per unit wavelength)
Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].s.documentation: Width of the slit (placed in the object focal plane)
Index in the error_description list for "slit_width"

charge_exchange.channel[:].spectrum[:].w.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "wavelengths"

charge_exchange.channel[:].t_i_average.documentation: Ion temperature (averaged on charge states and ion species) at the channel measurement point

charge_exchange.channel[:].t_i_average.d.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].t_i_average_m.documentation: Description of the method used to reconstruct the average ion temperature
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].zeff.documentation: Local ionic effective charge at the channel measurement point

charge_exchange.channel[:].zeff.data_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

charge_exchange.channel[:].zeff_line_ave.documentation: Ionic effective charge, line average along the channel line-of-sight
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Description of the method used to reconstruct the line average effective charge
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.channel[:].zeff_method.documentation: Description of the method used to reconstruct the local effective charge

charge_exchange.channel[:].zeff_method.i.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

charge_exchange.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

charge_exchange.code.library[:].paramete.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

charge_exchange.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

charge_exchange.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

charge_exchange.etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the optical system

charge_exchange.etendue_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "etendue"

charge_exchange.etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods

charge_exchange.etendue_method.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

charge_exchange.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

charge_exchange.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

charge_exchange.ids_properties.creation_.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

charge_exchange.ids_properties.homogeneo.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

charge_exchange.ids_properties.occurrenc.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

charge_exchange.ids_properties.provenanc.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

charge_exchange.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

charge_exchange.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

charge_exchange.ids_properties.version_p.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

charge_exchange.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

charge_exchange.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"
